job.job_description:
We are looking for a highly motivated specialist to design, develop and deliver security training for a very large, reputed Federal Government Agency in Canberra.

The Team plays a key role in the provision of security advice and support, both domestically and overseas. A core responsibility of the team is the security and safety of Australian personnels and their dependants overseas, the security of its diplomatic and consular posts and the safeguarding of sensitive information commensurate with an environment of increasing security risk.

Key Duties will Include,

• Deliver presentations and facilitate training to agency staff.
• Develop innovative, relevant, diversity enabled and culturally sensitive learning solutions for officers.
• Undertake continual analysis and review of OTS’ training curricula to ensure training aligns with company objectives.
• Develop ‘training strategies’ and produce ‘training outcome’ briefs and other high-level briefs as required, for the Executive.
• Identify security training and capability gaps and (where possible) determine strategies to reduce these through a process of continual monitoring and refining of company’s training to build and enhance security capability.

Skills and Experience

• Qualification and/or demonstrated experience in training and assessment.
• Previous experience in Protective Security would be desirable.
• Experience or knowledge of the overseas security environment is desirable.


Candidates must be Australian citizens – NV2 Australian Government clearance (mandatory). 

If this role is of interest to you, please APPLY NOW, or contact Dinushka Dodangollegama on 02 6113 7518.

Electrical Service Technician

Established in 1997, Our Client is a leading provider of high-performance systems and comprehensive support to the food and pharmaceutical manufacturing industry in Australia and New Zealand. Our clients commitment to excellence has made them the preferred choice for global manufacturers seeking inspection systems to comply with regulations and ensure product safety.

Our client offer's a range of innovative products, including metal detection systems, x-ray inspection systems, product handling solutions, and various instruments.

Job Description: We are seeking a Full-time, Electrical Service Technician to join our clients team in Sydney, NSW. In this role, you will collaborate closely with our valued customers, providing exceptional service, support, and training assistance both on-site and remotely. As a representative of our company, you will uphold our reputation for outstanding customer support and ensure the highest standard of service delivery.

Responsibilities:
  • Perform a variety of service procedures, including installation, commissioning, maintenance, and certification.
  • Diagnose and troubleshoot technical errors or problems, implementing effective solutions.
  • Scope and monitor project work until completion, ensuring adherence to timelines and quality standards.
  • Train clients on equipment usage and best practices, both in the field and at the factory.
  • Ensure compliance with product requirements and safety regulations.
Requirements:
  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a Service Technician, preferably in a similar role.
  • Proficient in electrical/electronic and mechanical/pneumatic skills, including the use of complex instruments like Digital Oscilloscopes, Radiation Monitoring Equipment, Optical CCD Camera Systems, and small-board computing systems.
  • Familiarity with LAN and WAN infrastructure, programming, and instrumentation.
  • Experience in the food processing industry is highly desirable.
  • Strong knowledge of servicing and maintaining complex equipment.
  • PLC experience is a plus.
  • Proficient in using common Windows programs and basic PC software and hardware.
  • Excellent relationship-building skills with a customer-focused mindset.
  • Self-motivated, punctual, and able to work effectively in both independent and team environments.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Flexibility to work occasional weekends and travel within Australia and overseas if required.
  • Possess a current and valid Australian Driver's License.
  • A-Grade Electrical license (desirable but not essential).
  • Willingness to undergo a National Police check and other relevant background checks.
Benefits:
  • Attractive base salary plus Super.
  • Company-provided vehicle, mobile phone, and laptop.
  • Comprehensive training on our products and services.
  • Opportunity for overseas travel based on performance.
  • Autonomy in work with the ability to adapt to changing priorities.
Join our clients dynamic team and seize the opportunity to utilize your technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and passion for providing exceptional service.
Apply now to become a valued member of Our Client's service team.

To apply, please send your WORD formatted resume and cover letter by clicking on quick apply.
For any questions please contact Alexander Dunbar - +61 2 9250 8043

job.job_skills: Proven experience within a Senior Legal Secretarial position
job.job_description:
This National Leading Law firm specialising in matters that affect everyday Australians, is seeking motivated and passionate senior legal secretaries to join their dynamic team. They believe that Legal Secretaries are the foundation and backbone to the success of the firm. Success is not only at an individual level, but it also requires a team of like-minded, driven and people who all believe in providing the best outcome for their clients.  

Due to significant growth, there is a need for several Senior Legal Secretaries based in head office located in Sydney CBD. Offering a 3/2 hybrid WFH policy. The Senior Legal Secretary is required to perform routine and non-routine clerical and administrative functions to actively support the supervising solicitor in the day-to-day operations of the practice whilst being rewarded for their efforts. To attract the best talent, they will offer the best in return!

This firm understands your worth and is offering above market salary packages + attractive company bonuses. Legal Secretaries are an asset and should never be seen as a liability or “Cost”.

Your duties will include and not be limited to:
  • Liaising with internal and external stake holders including clients, barristers, courts, medical professionals
  • Drafting of correspondence including Statements, application for mediation, letters of demand, statement of claims, client statements
  • Booking of appointments, conferences, mediation settlements
  • Monitoring all incoming emails and actioning accordingly
  • Diary Management
  • Prepare pleadings for district, supreme and federal court- consent order, short minutes, affidavits
  • Billing- prepare invoices, trust account authorities
  • Updating client files and record management
  • Working collaboratively across the business and assisting where required
The successful candidate will have the below skills and experience:
  • Proven experience within a busy Senior Legal Secretarial position 
  • Experience with high volume Invoicing and Billing
  • A pro-active ability to maintain high-quality work with exceptional attention to detail
  • A demonstrated ability to work independently and organise the workload to meet tight deadlines
  • An ability to apply compassion and empathy with clients.
  • Diary management and Outlook
  • Strong client-facing and communication skills
  • Strong administrative background with excellent typing and document drafting skills
  • Experience with Common Law claims, Personal Injury, Plaintiff cases highly desired but not essential
If you know you are the best at what you do and feel it is time to be appreciated, then it is time to take your career to the next step!

APPLY NOW! All applications and discussions will remain confidential.
